channel.title: SoftwareDevelopment on Compile My Mind
channel.description: Recent content in SoftwareDevelopment on Compile My Mind

item.title: Spring Annotations Guide: @EnableScheduling, @Scheduled, @Async, @EnableAsync, @Service, and @Configuration Examples
item.description: This post explains some of the most useful Spring annotations with minimal code you can paste into a project. We’ll cover what each annotation does, when to use it, and a short example.

item.title: Understanding Controller, Service, and Repository in Spring Boot
item.description: Java is truly an amazing programming language. And among its rich toolkit, Spring Boot definitely stands out as a powerful building block. With Spring Boot, we build fast, effective, and sustainable applications. In this article, we’ll take a closer look at the core layers of Spring Boot: Controller, Service, and Repository annotations.

item.title: Component vs Bean in Spring
item.description: Spring Framework provides a powerful Dependency Injection (DI) mechanism to manage application components. In this system, objects are managed by an IoC (Inversion of Control) container. But how do we tell Spring which classes or objects it should manage?
